etymology.description: 月(月) (yuè, "moon") + Semantic: 韋(韋) (wéi, "leather") = lunar first day direction -> north
etymology.interpretation: The character 朔(朔) (shuò, "north") combines 月(月) (yuè, "moon") which indicates the time of a new moon and 韋(韋) (wéi, "leather") which is phonetic. This implies the beginning of a lunar cycle, traditionally associated with the northern direction.

examples.chinese: 冬季来临时(冬季來臨時)，朔风凛冽(朔風凜冽)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngjì láilín shí, shuò fēng lǐnliè.
examples.english: When winter arrives, the north wind is fierce.

examples.chinese: 船队向朔方向驶去(船隊向朔方向駛去)。
examples.english: The fleet sailed towards the north.
